attributes.action: Doctors Surgery's to do walk in emergency appointments & bookable appointments.
attributes.additional_details: I would like the government or parliament to sort this as it would help hospitals out alot & people would be able to see a doctor at the doctors surgery, instead of going A&E.
attributes.background: Doctors Surgery's to stop this business of ringing up at eight o'clock & your in a queue & to get told theirs no emergency appointments left & a doctor will ring you back, people have had enough, this is why people go to A&E & this is why hospital are under pressure.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

Decisions about taking appointments are a matter for individual GPs, not the Government or House of Commons.

As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.
